t: What is brand preference, and why does it matter? | Amazon Ads
s: March 22, 2023 - Brand preference is when a customer identifies a preferred product and makes that brand a part of their regular purchasing routine. This might come after a consumer tests other products—trying out the competition but ultimately settling on one prevailing brand.

t: Set Amazon Products as Preferred for Buying - Business Accounts - Amazon Customer Service
s: To remove a brand, select the Actions link next to the brand in the brands list, and then select Remove. Note: You can view all your preferred items by selecting the preferred items tab in Buying policies & Approvals.

t: Guide buyers to purchase items from certain preferred brands | Amazon Business
s: Administrators using Business Prime can now create a policy for preferred brands. Preferred brands will be highlighted and promoted on search results, product pages and cart so that buyers are guided towards them. Admins can add and remove Amazon Private Brands as well as other brands from ...

t: Amazon is consumers preferred ad platform for a second year in a row
s: Among marketers, YouTube has leapfrogged to the top of the charts, improving trust by 6% compared with last year. The rise of YouTube demonstrates marketers’ preference for established, brands, even if it does not register in consumers’ top five platforms.
